description: An offensive comment Kelly Osbourne made in 2015 became a TikTok meme

title: Congress Votes to Avert Shutdown and Keep Government Funded Through Early March
description: Congress sent Joe Biden a short-term spending bill that would avert a partial government shutdown and fund federal agencies into March.

title: Your Questions About the New Hampshire Primary, Answered
description: When the New Hampshire primary will take place, who is on the ballot, why it's an important contest, and more key things to know about the vote.

description: Hertz's electric vehicle pullback is a reminder of the importance of consumer education.

title: The True Cost of Chinese Solar Panels
description: The U.S. can't allow China's global solar monopoly to continue, the true price of their panels is too high.

title: How Pigs Could Help People Who Need Liver Transplants
description: The experiment paves the way to one day use pig livers for patients waiting for transplants.

title: A New Nonprofit Is Seeking to Solve the AI Copyright Problem
description: As battles rage over AI copyright, a new nonprofit seeks to elevate "fairly trained" AI models.

title: India Is Unveiling Its Controversial Temple of Ram. Here’s What to Know
description: The Ram Mandir, a Hindu temple, will be consecrated Jan. 22 on a contested holy site once home to a mosque.

title: Water Is the New Oil in the Gulf
description: There's a growing recognition of water as a critical and finite resource in the driest part of the world—and it's prompting a reckoning.

title: Justice Department Report Finds ‘Cascading Failures’ and ‘No Urgency’ During Uvalde Shooting
description: DOJ identifies failed communication and leadership and inadequate technology and training that contributed to the Uvalde shooting crisis.

title: St. Croix Tap Water Remains Unsafe Two Months After Biden Declared State of Emergency
description: Residents of St. Croix, an Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands, maintain their water is still unsafe to drink.

title: Sheryl Sandberg to Leave Meta Board
description: Sheryl Sandberg, who had served as COO of Facebook, and then Meta, for 14 and a half years and as a board member for 12 years, will step down in May.

description: Americans have been isolated at the U.N. on Israel for a half century — but that used to prompt fierce debate.

title: Oppenheimer and Poor Things Lead the 2024 BAFTA Awards Nominations
description: Christopher Nolan’s Oppenheimer led the BAFTA shortlists with 13 nominations, while Yorgos Lanthimos’s Poor Things secured 11 nominations.

title: 3M Starts Issuing Payments to Veterans in $6 Billion Settlement Over Earplugs

description: Seven non-Iranians were killed in the explosions, which hit two locations around Iran’s border city of Saravan, local authorities said.

title: U.S. Launches More Strikes on Yemen’s Houthis as Red Sea Attacks Continue

title: Singaporean Transport Minister S. Iswaran Charged With Corruption
description: S. Iswaran is Singapore’s first key minister to get embroiled in a graft probe since 1986.
